in Southern California. There isn't much in this
suburb but it's possible to drive to many destinations in Southern California within an hour such as Disneyland, Hollywood and Downtown LA.

Simi Valley is mainly accessible by automobile.  Simi Valley's main artery, the 118 Freeway (Ronald Reagan Freeway), can be accessed by the 5 and 405 Freeways in the east and by the 23 Freeway in the west.  The 23 Freeway connects to the 101 Freeway.

Airports in close proximity to Simi Valley are

.  There are several small airports in the area that welcome private or charter flights.

Simi Valley is accessible by train through Amtrak's

Although Simi Valley has a bus system, the primary transportation by the city's residents is by automobile.  Bicycling is gaining in popularity as the city is committed to installing more bicycle lanes and bicycle parking.  Walking, although safe, is not recommended for more than a short stroll.  Distances can seem deceptively small, but map your distance if you're planning on walking or cycling from point to point.

value: . No smoking, eating, drinking or radios allowed on the buses.  Fare is $1.25 per trip.  Tickets can be purchased onboard but exact fare is required as drivers are unable to make change.  Stops are approximately 1/4 to 1/2 mile apart.
hours=Su - Sa 10AM to 5PM. Closed Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Day, and New Year’s Day
content=This is a must see for any travelers stopping by in Simi Valley. Admission: $12.
content=This gothic building was originally a family home, then a church, then a mortuary and is now a historical landmark. The building now houses a theatre for live plays. Admission: $20.
, Smith Road (east of Kuehner).  The Old Corriganville Movie Ranch with historic buildings was the site of many western films.  Park also has a two-mile trail loop.

, West end of Simi Valley.  Usually known as "the hill with the cross on top of it," it's visible from Madera Road.  Hiking trail is approximately two miles long but can be difficult.  Wear long pants and snake boots.
content=Restored 1903 train depot now holds a small museum and a working model train layout.
hours=T - F 9AM - 2PM, Tours W 1PM & Sa - Su 1PM - 4PM
content=Buildings and artifacts from Simi Valley's pioneer history.
content=Once home of Tressa Prisbrey created from recyclable items from a local landfill, now a California Historical Landmark.
, Metrolink Station to Madera Road.  Seven miles of paved bikepath with trees, flowers and a stream.  Also suitable for walking.
, Equestrian Center to Tierra Practice Rejada Park. Four miles of dirt pathway, away from the street, complemented by trees and flowers.
, South end of First Street.  Open through permit only (contact the park service).  Two miles of hiking trail.  Oak groves and a stream.
, Flanagan Drive and Broken Arrow.  Two and a half mile hiking trail overlooking Native American rock shelters.
, Kuehner Drive and 118 Freeway.  Three mile hiking trail with hills and wildlife.
content=Local hiking group that conducts a variety of hikes on a regular schedule.

content=Swimming pool, tennis, basketball, softball, volleyball, shuffleboard, horseshoes, covered picnic area, barbeques, playgrounds. A stream leads down to a lagoon stocked with fish. Site of the Annual Huck Finn Fishing Derby. Be careful feeding the ducks.
, 3700 Avenida Simi.  Basketball, softball, shuffleboard, horseshoes, covered picnic area, barbeques, playgrounds.  A very nice dirt walking path.  Simi Valley's Veteran's Plaza.
content=Rancho Santa Susanna Community Park. Memorial Day Weekend. Annual festival celebrating all things Cajun. Check website for parking details.
content=Public course, 9 hole, par 3. Driving range, practice green and pro shop.
content=Public course, 18 hole, par 71. Driving range, practice green and pro shop. Very nice for a public course.
content=Open Daily. Public course, 36 holes. Practice range, pro shop and clubhouse.
content=This open air mall has just opened in 2005 and is located between two off-ramps on the 118 Freeway (Erringer and First Street).
content=Pizza by the slice, whole pies, calzones, strombolis, cannoli.

content=Red's is very popular so expect a wait if you're going for dinner on Friday or Saturday night. Don't miss the ribs or the baked potatoes (caution: baked potatoes are huge). Take out menu available.
content=All you can eat pizza/salad/dessert bar with all you can drink soday.
. Hands down the best pizza in Simi Valley.  Largest pizza is 28 inches - very good for parties.  Order early - delivery can take 45 minutes.
content=Upscale steakhouse. Reservations can be made online. Portions are very large. Dinner can get pricey.
content=Don't be put off by the decor, the food is excellent. Very popular with the lunch crowd. Very affordable.
content=Old school Italian restaurant with what is probably the original decor. Order the family meal, it is the best deal in town.
hours=Lunch T - Sa / Dinner T - Su. Closed Monday
content=Cajun/Creole restaurant tucked into a strip mall behind the Chevron station. Excellent food.
content=Open for breakfast and lunch. This is where Simi Valley eats breakfast. Check for the specials on the front board. On weekends, go early or be prepared for a long wait.
directions=On Los Angeles between First St and Madera. On North side of Los Angeles Ave.
content=Fine Italian food. Great for dinner.
directions=behind Los Angeles Avenue A&W fast food restaurant
content=Snookies is the only bikini bar in Simi Valley.
content=All rooms come with free breakfast. Book in advance, prices can go up steeply.
content=One of the newer hotels in Simi Valley, had nice rooms and amenities.
content=Standard lodging at an inexpensive price. Rates remain low even if booked at the last moment.
content=Rooms include a kitchenette. Pet allowed with fee.
name=Best Western Posada Royale Hotel & Suites
content=Posada Royale is affiliated with Best Western. Hotel is a bit out of the way.
content=Although the decor of this hotel could be updated, the proximity to the Simi Valley Town Center can not be beaten.
. This historic railroad has been restored and now offers themed excursions for holidays, parties or simply dinner.  Price varies widely depending on excursion.
